doc.field: Letter to Angelica Schuyler Church (January 7, 1789) [a machine-readable transcription]
Letter to Angelica Schuyler Church (January 7, 1789) [a machine-readable transcription]
Print copy consulted: University of Virginia Special Collections, Angelica Schuyler Church Archive, accession number 11245
Print copy consulted: University of Virginia Special Collections, Angelica Schuyler Church Archive, accession number 11245

Inclosed My Dear friend is a letter from your sister; which she has written to supply my deficiency. Tomorrow I open the budget & you may imagine that to day I am very busy and not a little anxious. I could not however let the Packet sail without giving you a proof, that no degree of occupation can make me forget you.

We hope to hear shortly that you are safe arrived & that every thing is to your wish. That Mr. Church is well, young and sprightly. And that your sons promise all to be great men, and your daughters to be like y yourself.
Adieu Love to Mr Church & believe me always Yr Affectionate friend & brother New York January 7. 1789. A Hamilton M. rs A Church
letter to angelica schuyler church january 7 1789 a machine readable transcription
